titleInfo.title: Keep Away from the Fellow Who Owns an Automobile

subject.topic: New South period and the industrialization of Tennessee .

mods.note: Sheet music of an entertaining song from the early 20th century about the perils of dating a fellow who owns an automobile. It warns girls of dangers such as running out of gas in distant places and the fellow demanding a kiss in exchange for the drive home.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
